alert.note: Alert for East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; Northern Dona Ana County; Southeast Tularosa Basin; West Central Tularosa Basin, White Sands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:27PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otero and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 625 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of White Sands National Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White Sands National Park, Portions of Jornada Experimental Range, and Lake Lucero. This includes Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 177 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; Northern Dona Ana County; Southeast Tularosa Basin; West Central Tularosa Basin, White Sands
